xxl.core.math.queries
Interface WindowQuery

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractKernelCDF, EmpiricalCDF, HybridKernelCDF, NativeKernelCDF, ReflectionKernelCDF
public interface WindowQuery

Classes implementing this interface are able to consume a window query returning the selectivity or any other associated numerical value to the given window. For instance, for a given window query the variance of the values could be regarded. A window query presumes numerical data at least over an interval scale, i.e., data only supporting categorical scales like an ordinal scale or a nominal scale could not be queried with a window query.
A range query differs from a window query by the supported statistical scale.
Range queries presume an ordered data space over a categorical scale, i.e., the difference between the range borders is not defined. Moreover, in contrast to a window query the right range border not belongs to the query range, i.e., a range query could be expressed with [a,b) in contrast to a window query like [a,b].

See Also:
RangeQuery, PointQuery

Method Summary
 double windowQuery(java.lang.Object a, java.lang.Object b)
          Returns the selectivity (true selectivity or an estimation) or any other associated numerical value to the given window.
 

Method Detail

windowQuery

double windowQuery(java.lang.Object a,
                   java.lang.Object b)
Returns the selectivity (true selectivity or an estimation) or any other associated numerical value to the given window.

Parameters:
a - left border(s) of the queried window
b - right border(s) of the queried window
Returns:
a numerical value respectively the selectivity associated with the given query
